author: National Bureau
text:
In back-to-back statements between Thursday and Friday, the RSS moved from saying that homosexuality was a personal matter and should not be a crime to calling it a psychological problem that should be treated and taking a stand against gay marriages.

On Friday morning, RSS joint general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale tweeted, “Homosexuality is not a crime, but socially immoral act in our society. No need to punish, but to be treated as a psychological case.”

He added in another tweet: “Gay marriage is Institutionalisation of homosexuality. It should be prohibited.”

A day earlier, Mr. Hosabale had taken what seemed like a soft line on homosexuality, saying in reply to a question at an India Today event that it be should not be considered a criminal offence.

While the line that it should not be a crime stays — a gain in itself for voices seeking decriminalisation of homosexuality — there is a disapproval of homosexuality in the Friday tweets.

IPC Section 377 criminalises sexual acts against the order of nature, and there has been much controversy over whether this should be so for acts between consenting adults. To a question on Thursday, Mr. Hosabale had said sexual preferences were a personal matter and the organisation did not hold any view on it. “I don’t think homosexuality should be considered a criminal offence as long as it does not affect others in society,” he had said at the India Today Conclave.
title: Homosexuality not a crime, but socially immoral act, says RSS
